traffic_model

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • traffic_model.Model

  • public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains variables and methods which are utilised to run the agent-based traffic model.
    Author:
    User

    • Constructor Detail

      • Model

        public Model(int runtime,
             double animationSpeed,
             int redLightLength,
             javax.swing.JPanel mPanel,
             javax.swing.JPanel sPanel)
        Parameters:
        runtime - The number of ticks the model will run for.
        animationSpeed - The speed in which each tick occurs in real-time.

    • Method Detail

      • getLightList

        public java.util.ArrayList<TrafficLight> getLightList()
        Returns the traffic light list.
        Returns:
        List of traffic lights.

      • runModel

        public void runModel()
        Runs the model.

      • moveVehicle

        public void moveVehicle(Vehicle vehicle)
        Tries to move the inputed vehicle one road tile.
        Parameters:
        vehicle - The vehicle to move.

      • moveTo

        public Road moveTo(int currentY,
                   int currentX)
        Moves to the next road tile. The reason this method does not use the current road tile index to find the next tile is so that future versions of the software can more easily integrate intersecting roads that do not follow a specific road circuit.
        Parameters:
        currentX - The current x position.
        currentY - The current y position.
        Returns:
        The road tile that is to be moved to(which encapsulates the x and y coordinates).

      • findRoadType

        public int findRoadType(int rawRoadValue)
        Finds and returns the road type of the inputed road value (Road type being the direction the road is facing i.e north = 1, east = 2, south = 3, west = 4). Filters out any overlapping objects such as vehicles and traffic lights.
        Returns:
        A value in the range of 1-4 corresponding to the inputed tile's directional road value.

      • onCornerFindRoad

        public Road onCornerFindRoad(int cornerY,
                             int cornerX,
                             int currentRoadType)
        If the new road tile is an empty space (tile with a 0) it will recalculate the new tile by searching for surrounding tiles around the current tile that have a different road value from the current (Because an adjoining road will have a different direction value).
        Parameters:
        cornerY - The y coordinate of the corner tile.
        cornerX - The x coordinate of the corner tile.
        currentRoadType - An integer value corresponding to the current road type/direction the road is facing.
        Returns:
        The road tile of the adjoining road.

      • listRoad

        public void listRoad()
        Gets an ordered list of each element in the road network. Follows the direction of the road. Used to get a similarly ranked list of vehicles.

      • listVehicles

        public void listVehicles()
        Using the list of road tiles, this method will generate a list of all vehicles ordered by their position on the road. It makes a new Vehicle() whenever it finds a road tile of 10,11,12 or 13 (tiles that signify there is vehicle on it).

      • listTrafficLights

        public void listTrafficLights()
        Using the list of road tiles, generates a list of all the traffic lights ordered by their position on the road. Makes a TrafficLight() whenever it finds a tile over the value of 100.

      • autoAddVehicles

        public void autoAddVehicles()
        Automatically adds a vehicle in every 6 spaces of the road network. Skips over traffic lights. Can be pressed multiple times to add more vehicles.

      • calcPercentStoodStill

        public double calcPercentStoodStill()
        Calculates the percentage of vehicles currently stood still.

      • calcAverageVehicleDist

        public double calcAverageVehicleDist()
        Calculates the average number of tiles the closest vehicle is to the vehicle in front.

      • calcListAverage

        public double calcListAverage(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> list)
        Calculates the overall average of values in the given list.
